   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, render_smoke/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,
   28:          render_non_native/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,40}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop}
   43:     ].
   44: 
   45: groups() ->
   46:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   47:       {render, [], [render_smoke, render, render_non_native, links, normalize]}
   48:     ].
   49: 
   50: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   51: %% is rendered correctly.
   52: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   53:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   54:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   55: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   56:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   63:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   64: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   71: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   72: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   73: %%
   74: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   75: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   76: %%
   77: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   78: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   79: %% tested.
   80: %%
   81: %% Currently the modules are:
   82: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
   83: %% If you need to update the definition because this
   84: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
   85: render(Config) ->
   86: 
   87:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   88: 
   89:     lists:foreach(
   90:       fun(Module) ->
   91:               {ok, [D]} = file:consult(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1")),
   92:               maps:map(
   93:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
   94:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
   95:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
   96:                                 ok;
   97:                             {ok, Original} ->
   98:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
   99:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  100:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  101:                             {error, enoent} ->
  102:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  103:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  104:                                 %% available on windows.
  105:                                 ok
  106:                         end
  107:                 end, render_module(Module, D))
  108:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  109: 
  110: update_render() ->
  111:     update_render(
  112:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  113:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  114: update_render(DataDir) ->
  115:     lists:foreach(
  116:       fun(Module) ->
  117:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  118:                   {ok, D} ->
  119:                       ok = file:write_file(
  120:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  121:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[D])),
  122:                       maps:map(
  123:                         fun(FName, Output) ->
  124:                                 ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  125:                         end, render_module(Module, D));
  126:                   E ->
  127:                       io:format("Error processing: ~p ~p",[Module, E])
  128:               end
  129:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  130: 
  131: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  132:   ok;
  133: handle_error(Doc) ->
  134:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  135: 
  136: render_smoke(_Config) ->
  137:     docsmap(
  138:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  139:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  140:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  141:                         catch _:undef -> []
  142:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  143:               pmap(
  144:                 fun(Config) ->
  145:                         try
  146:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  147:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  148:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  149: 
  150:                             [try
  151:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  152:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  153:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  154:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  155:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  156:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports],
  157: 
  158:                             [try
  159:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  160:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  161:                                      io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  162:                                                [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  163:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  164:                              end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs],
  165: 
  166:                             [try
  167:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  168:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  169:                                      io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  170:                                                [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  171:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  172:                              end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  173:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  174:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  175:                                 exit(R)
  176:                         end
  177:                 end, format_configurations())
  178:       end),
  179:     ok.
  180: 
  181: docsmap(Fun) ->
  182:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  183:             F(Mod);
  184:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  185:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  186:           F(Mod) ->
  187:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  188:               {error, missing} ->
  189:                 ok;
  190:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  191:                 ok;
  192:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  193:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  194:                 ok;
  195:               {error, eisdir} ->
  196:                 %% Uhm?
  197:                 ok;
  198:               {ok, Docs} ->
  199:                 try
  200:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  201:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  202:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  203:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  204:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  205:                 end
  206:             end
  207:       end,
  208:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  209:   ok.
  210: 
  211: 
  212: format_configurations() ->
  213:   [#{},
  214:    #{ ansi => false },
  215:    #{ ansi => true },
  216:    #{ columns => 5 },
  217:    #{ columns => 150 },
  218:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  219:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  220: 
  221: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  222:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  223:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  224:     case Format of
  225:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  226:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  227:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  228:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  229:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  230:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  231:         _  ->
  232:             Docs
  233:     end.
  234: 
  235: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  236: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  237:     Doc;
  238: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  239:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  240: 
  241: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  242:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  243: 
  244: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  245:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  246: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  247:     Entry;
  248: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  249:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  250:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  251: 
  252: 
  253: render_prop(Config) ->
  254: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  255:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  256:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  257: 
  258: links(_Config) ->
  259:     docsmap(
  260:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  261:               try
  262:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  263:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  264:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  265:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  266:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  267:               end,
  268:               [try
  269:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  270:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  271:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  272:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  273:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  274:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  275:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  276:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  277:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  278:       end).
  279: 
  280: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  281:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  282:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  283:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  284:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  285:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  286:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  287:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  288:                                                     b2a(Func),
  289:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  290:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  291:                                                 b2a(Func),
  292:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  293:                                 _Else  -> ok
  294:                             end;
  295:                         _Else ->
  296:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  297:                     end;
  298:                 _Callback ->
  299:                     ok
  300:             end;
  301:         _OtherlinkType ->
  302:             ok
  303:     end,
  304:     check_links(Mod, C),
  305:     check_links(Mod, T);
  306: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  307:     check_links(Mod, C),
  308:     check_links(Mod, T);
  309: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  310:     check_links(Mod, T);
  311: check_links(_, []) ->
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: normalize(_Config) ->
  315:     ?assertMatch(
  316:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  317:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  318:       ),
  319:     ?assertMatch(
  320:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  321:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  322:       ),
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  326: b2a(Bin) ->
  327:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  328:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  329:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  330:     end.
  331: 
  332: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  333: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  334:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  335:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  336:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  337:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  338:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  339:         docs = []
  340:     },
  341: 
  342:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  343:       "    This is\n"
  344:       "    \n"
  345:       "    pure text\n">> =
  346:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  347:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  348: 
  349:     ok.
  350: 
  351: %% Testing functions
  352: render_all(Dir) ->
  353:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  354:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  355:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  356:     %% belongs to.
  357:     PossibleApplications =
  358:         lists:flatmap(
  359:           fun(P) ->
  360:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  361:           end, code:get_path()),
  362:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  363:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  364:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  365:                     maps:map(
  366:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  367:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  368:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  369:             end).
  370: 
  371: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  372:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  373:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  374:         {ok, App} ->
  375:             App;
  376:         _ ->
  377:             App = unknown
  378:     end,
  379:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  380:     Files =
  381:         #{
  382:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  383:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  384:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  385:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  386:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  387:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  388:          },
  389:     lists:foldl(
  390:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  391:               Acc;
  392:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  393:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  394:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  395:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  396:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  397:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  398:                   true -> 
  399:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  400:                   false ->
  401:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  402:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  403:               end;
  404:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  405:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  406:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  407:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  408:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  409:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  410:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  411:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  412:       end, Files, Docs).
  413: 
  414: sanitize(FName) ->
  415:     lists:foldl(
  416:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  417:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  418:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  419:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  420: 
  421: %%
  422: %% Parallel map function.
  423: %%
  424: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  425: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  426: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  427: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  428: %% the job to do be done.
  429: %%
  430: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  431: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  432: %%
  433: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  434:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  435:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  436:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  437:                    end, Ls),
  438:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  439:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  440:   ok.
  441: 
  442: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  443:   _ = F(Item),
  444:   Pid ! ok.
  445: 
  446: sync(0) ->
  447:   ok;
  448: sync(N) ->
  449:   receive
  450:     ok ->
  451:       sync(N-1)
  452:   end.
